qas.question: What popular Samoan band has a number in its name?
What song covered by a Samoan group was a 1974 number one in New Zealand?
What award did King Kapisi win for his song Reverse Resistance?

answers.text: New Zealand APRA Silver Scroll Award

qas.question: Which hip hop artist filmed a music video for his song Suamalie in Samoa?
What year did King Kapisi become the first hip hop artist to win an APRA Silver Scroll?
When did the band The Five Stars reach number one on the New Zealand charts?

plausible_answers.text: New Zealand APRA Silver Scroll Award

qas.question: What award did Penina o Tiafu recieve in 1999?
What song did Penina o Tiafau win the award for in 1999?
What kind of music style does Penina o Tiafau use?
Where was The Five Stars music video filmed?

context: In music, popular local bands include <a0_0>The Five Stars<a0_0/>, Penina o Tiafau and Punialava'a. The Yandall Sisters' cover of the song <a1_0>Sweet Inspiration<a1_0/> reached number one on the New Zealand charts <b5_0>in 1974<b5_0/>. King Kapisi was the first <b8_0>hip hop<b8_0/> artist to receive the prestigious <a2_0><b6_0>New Zealand APRA Silver Scroll Award<b6_0/><a2_0/> in <a4_0>1999<a4_0/> for his song <b7_0>Reverse Resistance<b7_0/>. The music video for Reverse Resistance was filmed in Savai'i at his villages. Other successful Samoan hip hop artists include rapper Scribe, Dei Hamo, Savage and <a3_0>Tha Feelstyle<a3_0/> whose music video Suamalie was filmed <b9_0>in Samoa<b9_0/>.
